author: Special Correspondent
text:
Direct paddy procurement centres are expected to come up in five blocks in the district shortly.

The District Collector held discussion with the officials on the setting up of the DPCs here on Friday.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Sampath said that the State Civil Supplies Corporation from October 1, 2015 onwards has been procuring fine variety paddy at Rs. 1,520 per quintal and common variety at Rs. 1,460 per quintal.

The government opened a direct procurement centre at Thevur village, in Sankagiri taluk, and procured 68 metric tonnes of paddy. The district administration has planned to set up direct procurement centres in Omalur, Edappadi, Attur, Gangavalli, and Sankagiri blocks, where paddy is the major crop raised by the farmers. P. Sinnababu, Regional Manager, TNCSC, and other officials participated.
title: Paddy procurement centres to be opened shortly
